required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intraocular Pressure and Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter Changes at Different PEEP Levels
clinical_study.official_title: Intraocular Pressure and Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter Changes at Different Positive End-expiratory Pressure Applications in Laparotomic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) is sometimes used during perioperative period, as it has favourable effects on lung mechanics. Unfortunately, it has some negative effects on the patients, like increased intraabdominal, intrathoracic, intracranial and intraocular pressures. In this study the investigators aimed to investigate the effects of different PEEP levels on the patients' intraocular and intracranial pressures. Intraocular pressure will be measured by ocular tonometry, and intracranial pressure will be estimated by optic nerve sheath diameter measurement. The measurements will be performed in the operating room in the patients undergoing laparotomic surgery.

primary_outcome.description: The physiological value for intraocular pressure is 10-20 mm Hg. Changes in intraocular pressure will be observed throughout the surgery, as will its relationship with the positive end-expiratory pressure application.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in optic nerve sheath diameter
primary_outcome.description: Changes in optic nerve sheath diameter will be observed throughout the surgery, as will its relationship with the positive end-expiratory pressure application.

intervention.description: Different levels of positive end-expiratory pressure (i.e., 5, 10 and 15 cm H2O) will be applied to the groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing laparotomy for gastrointestinal surgery
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) 1 or 2 physical status
- Elective surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with glaucoma
- ASA 3 or over physical status
- Emergency surgery

overall_official.affiliation: Marmara University School of Medicine, Dep of Anesthesiology and Reanimation
